title: how does riot seriously still justify deducting LP in ranked when people afk from start to finish

replies.body: maybe riot is afraid if someone afks and the other 4 doesnt lose any LP then what if a game is 15 minutes in and the score is 1-29 and everyone on the losing team harrasses one person to make him go afk so they won't lose any LP. i agree that it really sucks to lose LP because of someone's connection going wrong or something, but the thing I don't get is CSGO kind of uses this system and i've havent seen a player been harrassed when the score is 1-10.
Because Riot is too fucking lazy to develop a system that will work, its as simple as that.
Works well in dota where if there's an afk/dc after 5 minutes that the game isn't recorded and people are free to leave. Never seen a single person abuse it.
It was quite the standard on HoN.

Matchmaking balancement.

Although to be (un)fair, they could just make it so you don't lose LP, and it'd still be a balanced system. You'd just lose double the next game, 'cause LP loss is based on MMR (and yeah, you still lose that, we don't want to mess up with rating).
It'd shut up a lot of complaints from the guys who don't get how it works... But probably create cases where the same guys think they can abuse the system.
Idk. People are weird.

Maybe the simple solution is if someone afks' or leaves the game pauses until they come back or until 5 minutes expires. If the person doesn't return other team can then vote andshow mercy, game ends but u don't lose full LP only half of what you would've and the person who left loses full amount of LP. This can still be abused by someone leaving. However mercy system is there incase its genuine or not genuine rage quit/dc. Then they can vote no and you all lose LP.

Bad team comp, no worries just take turns afking every time you get a bad comp 1 person losses lp but the other 4 don't...

This among other reasons is why Riot won't change the way it works, besides it is more likely the enemy team get's an afk as long as you never do yourself.
